criteria: Understanding of Common Mental Health Conditions
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of signs of disordered eating.
Student can identify a few basic signs of disordered eating with significant inaccuracies.
Student identifies some signs of disordered eating, but understanding is superficial and lacks depth.
Student accurately describes several signs of disordered eating, demonstrating a moderate understanding.
Student comprehensively describes most signs of disordered eating, showing a strong understanding of the topic.
Student thoroughly and insightfully describes numerous signs of disordered eating, demonstrating a deep and nuanced understanding. Goes beyond the basic signs to explore underlying factors.
Student demonstrates no understanding of common mental health conditions.
Student identifies one or two common mental health conditions, but definitions are vague and inaccurate.
Student identifies a few common mental health conditions, but explanations are incomplete and lack detail.
Student accurately describes several common mental health conditions, demonstrating a moderate understanding.
Student comprehensively describes most common mental health conditions, showing a strong understanding of the topic.
Student thoroughly and insightfully describes numerous common mental health conditions, demonstrating a deep and nuanced understanding. Explores complexities and overlaps between conditions.
Student does not explain why recognizing signs of disordered eating or mental health conditions is important.
Student provides a weak or illogical explanation of the importance of recognizing signs.
Student provides a basic explanation of the importance of recognizing signs, but lacks detail and clarity.
Student explains the importance of recognizing signs in a general way, with some supporting reasons.
Student clearly explains the importance of recognizing signs, providing specific and relevant reasons.

Student eloquently and persuasively explains the importance of recognizing signs, providing compelling reasons and real-world examples. Demonstrates awareness of the potential consequences of not recognizing signs.
